intro: Dentidia purpurea, commonly known as purple dentidia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Dentidia purpurea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and native garden landscaping.
